Properties

CodeURLTypeDescription
statushttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#statuscodeStatus of the concept
deprecatedhttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#v2-table-deprecatedcodeVersion of HL7 in which the code was deprecated

This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0504 defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
EE End related service request(s), end current service request.End related service request(s), end current service request.
ES End related service request(s), start current service request.End related service request(s), start current service request.
SS Start related service request(s), start current service request.Start related service request(s), start current service request.
SE Start related service request(s), end current service request.Start related service request(s), end current service request.

name: SequenceCondition
title: sequenceCondition
description: HL7-defined code system of concepts used to specify the relationship between the start/end of the related service request(s) (from TQ2-3, TQ2-4 or TQ2-5) and the current service request from ORC-2, 3 or 4.  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the TQ2 segment.
purpose: Underlying Master Code System for V2 table 0504 (Sequence Condition Code)
copyright: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain

property.description: Version of HL7 in which the code was deprecated

concept.display: End related service request(s), end current service request.
concept.definition: End related service request(s), end current service request.

concept.display: End related service request(s), start current service request.
concept.definition: End related service request(s), start current service request.

concept.display: Start related service request(s), start current service request.
concept.definition: Start related service request(s), start current service request.

concept.display: Start related service request(s), end current service request.
concept.definition: Start related service request(s), end current service request.
